intro: Anarthria laevis, commonly known as the smooth anarthria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
